title: Rewrite extract_host_port to work with IPv6 addresses
body: `url.host_str()` returns IPv6 adresses surrounded with square brackets, which does not work with ToSocketAddrs.

title: Add docs badge
body: It was a bit frustrating to scroll down to the documentation link every time I wanted to look something up, so I added you a badge to the top of the readme :)

title: Add Send trait bounds to the Futures
body: Tokio's executor trait requires `Send` to be implemented on the future to be spawned.

title: Expose the original request URI prior to UPGRADE
body: moved to this PR so it can be rebased, original is #161

title: fix links in README.md
body:
## Notes
- Travis-CI is not setup for this project?
- The links http://websocket-rs.github.io/rust-websocket/autobahn and http://cyderize.github.io/rust-websocket/autobahn are both not correct.

title: fix send extra tcp package
body: write_fmt will repeatedly call write_str and send mutli tcp package

title: Remove strange type in recv_message signature
Fix styling errors in previous PR.
body: PR #143 had styling errors, quick fix PR.

title: Fix typo and style in documents
Update base64 and replace use of deprecated Future::boxed
body:
`base64`: previously websocket had to be built with two versions of base64 (0.5 and 0.6) to support both its own use and hyper's.

`Future::boxed`: see https://github.com/alexcrichton/futures-rs/issues/556.

title: Expose websocket::server::upgrade::validate
body: I need to access this primitive. The API seems reasonable for public consumption and exposing it doesn't uncover any internal types.

title: Bump bitflags to 0.9 and bump version
Create example for parallel server
body: This server sends and receives messages independently

title: Dataframe reads all of payload.
body: Fixes #119 , also fixes a small inefficiency, adds tests, removes unneeded TODOs

title: Return Box<... + Send> from ClientBuilder::connect
body: Make it actually useful in multi-threaded environment.

title: removed rust serialize
body:
See #118, rustc-serialize is gone.

I didn't need serde for any of the stuff within the main library, because the only thing rustc-serialize was being used for was base64 encoding and decoding - the base64 crate was used instead.

I have added serde_json as a dev dependency, because there was some json decoding in the autobahn client.

Let me know what you think?

title: move set_nonblocking() to server with OptionalSslAcceptor
body: Method `set_nonblocking()` is only implemented for servers with `SslAcceptor`, although its implementation is also valid for non-SSL servers. This moves the method to the non-specific server implementations, so it can be used for both.

title: Add tokio support.
body:
This will let us have efficient servers and be able to multiplex ordinarily blocking code.
Fixes #88 and will help with servo/servo#16236
